projectType: Full-Stack development,Entertainment, Music, Data Model Design, Database Schema Design, REST APIs, Data Retrieval
reasonNotFinished: Fully working state. I have more features planned, so can't really say it's finished.
description: spotiVersus is a mini-game of guessing which of the two artists displayed has a higher number of monthly listeners on Spotify. At the start, a number of artists is pulled from a database.

projectType: Full-Stack development, Responsive Design, Database Management, UI/UX
description: A mock-website for a small Pizza shop. The business rules did not require user authentication, so login/registration was not implemented. Each order is registered and assigned a persistant unique ID.

projectType: Process Automation, File Organization, Integration with Other Tools, Open-Closed Design, File Parsing
description: Mass-checking of student submitted code downloaded through Pilot Learning Management System (LMS) for purposes of cheating deterrence. A python script that expects a zip file downloaded from an LMS, which then unzips it and creates a folder named after the student's last name with their most-recently submitted files. This script was later adapted by the CS Dev team at Wright State University and refactored to be used as a /command in the CS Discord server.

projectType: Entertainment, Games, Bounded-Limits Ruleset, Input Handling, Game Logic Design
reasonNotFinished: Will refactor into Flutter code to deploy for iOS and Android.
description: Math game where the player must keep the running total inbetween two bounds. A random number is shown, and the player has to choose between three operations to perform on the random number and the running total number, ensuring that the operation would not result in a total outside of the set bounds.

projectType: Web Scraping, Machine Learning, Data Analysis, Feature Extraction, Data Preprocessing, Random Forest, Data Resampling, Feature Derivation
tech: Python, Matplotlib, keras, numpy, pandas, Jupyter Notebooks
description: Soccer match predictions using machine learning techniques, including data preprocessing and cleanup, feature extraction and derivation, and model optimization.

projectType: Educational, Memory Management and Memory Leak Analysis, Hashing (jsHash), Object-Oriented Programming, Recursion, Complexity Analysis, Unit Testing
description: Data structures implementations in C++ with focus on performance and low memory usage. Implementing: Doubly-Linked List (Sequence), Balanced Binary Tree (AVL Tree), Tries (Auto-Completion Trie), HashDatabase.

projectType: Full-Stack Development, CRUD Operations, Data Visualization, Asset Management System, Authentication
description: Qiddiyah Cabins - Find Your Desert Sanctuary. An internal dashboard designed for the management of a cabin-renting firm. The dashboard allows for authenticated staff members to perform CRUD operations on a postgreSQL database for the firm's cabins. More features planned such as statistics for income, guest retention, average number of stays, etc.
Learning the GOTTH stack - Golang, Templ, Tailwind, HTMX for both Backend and Frontend development.
Learning Angular v18 for enterprise work.
Learning Rails for Ruby for enterprise work. Low priority atm.

projectType: Full-Stack development, Responsive Mobile First Design, Data Model Design, Database Schema Design, CRON Jobs, Web Scraping, Cloudflare Hosting, NoSQL Databases, SEO Optimization, Async/Await
description: Tuwaiq Tracker is a service that tracks courses published on Tuwaiq Academy, offering features such as sorting and filtering them. Bootcamps, programs, challenges, meetings, newly-added courses, and starting-soon courses are marked for easier identification by the user with a legend to assist, as well. The website relies on a MongoDB collection for settings and courses. An API GET endpoint is setup to check Tuwaiq Academy for new courses.

projectType: Full-Stack development, Responsive Mobile First Design, Hobby project
description: Catus Locatus is a lost pet finding app. Announce a pet you lost by showing others where it was lost. Other people can contact you if they find your pet! All pets are drawn on top of a Leaflet map, with dog/cat emojis for easier searching. The website only accepts coordinates of your current location, to reduce the number of false reports.
